content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Squad based combat is original, with different roles and armies inside the same side, but sometiemes it is easy to miss the point of being in a squad (it only works if all your squad-mates are really on it). The scenarios are huge and fun, with some minor bugs (some really frustrating bugs with textures when you lay on the ground and can't aim at an enemy because you're inside a trench and the game doesn't allow you to roll or move left or right). They still have to work more in the animations of the soldiers (too simple movements) and explosions (they're ugly), and add some more realistic features (when lying in the ground you can still move while aiming, which is absolutly unrealistic). But overall, I bet this will be an amazing game when the time comes (now it's in alpha), fun to play and competitive: a good Great War version of Red Orchestra 2. They amazingly caught the atmosphere of the trenches, the crazy no-man-land battles in which hundreds die in a hundred metres, with attacks, counter-attacks and a very dynamic course of the game (capture the trench style is quite better than the old capture the flag or the "attack-defend maps"). I recommend it for RO2-RS, RO1, Arma and M&B Warband mods veterans: historically realistic and enjoyable. What's bad about it? It's still an Alpha (with some minor bugs) and the graphics aren't great (just good enough), but you already have a big and active community so you will always, anytime of the day, find squads and full servers.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								Verdun is an FPS game that brings back the more realistic and strategic gun game. Unlike 99% of FPS games made, only 1 or 2 shots will kill an enemy and you can really feel the burden of your equipment. Players must try to run gaps, crouch behind cover, and lay prone in ditches in order to stay hidden. Its atmosphere is well made and really enhance the gameplay. So far there are only 2 modes, deathmatch, and frontline. Deathmatch is like it sounds, you choose a gun, and fight everyone you see and try not to die (much). Frontlines is a very nice system that matches with the war theme. It is a mixture of capture the flag and deathmatch. Much like battlefield, there are 2 teams and in each team a number of squads. But in each squad there are only 4 classes and each one can only be chosen once. This makes it so communication and strategy is a must in order to do well for the team. The goal is to attack the trenches or defend them. Kind of like tug of war, each side must try to overcome the enemy and gain the most territory.Overall, I am having a very good time playing this game and recommend it to those looking for a good fps game that is not a bullet sponge fest. Yes, there are many bugs and it is not optimized very well yet, but it is also early access and those things will be fixed over time. The content that is in the game right now is well done and once it gains more content and a larger following, it will be a long lasting game that will provide many hours of fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												Not only are WWI games rare, but Verdun is a damn good one.The thing about this game that truly makes it stand out in my eyes is the sheer brutality of it. (You'll need to turn the gore setting to ULTRA to experience this.)Imagine you're a British soldier on the front lines. You glance over the top of the trench and see a German hard charging toward you. You squeeze a shot off and Gerry drops about 20 meters in front of your trench. As you chamber a new round in your rifle, you hear the soldier you just shot let out a bloodcurdling scream. You wait for more to arrive, and the screaming has only gotten louder. This isn't a low-pitched scream of a large man, this is the scream of someone very young, probably not even in his 20's yet. Eventually, he succumbs to his wounds and the screaming ceases.Verdun has something that a lot of shooters lack, the dying. Take Call of Doots: You shoot someone, they die, you move on. Then you have Verdun: You gut shoot someone and you can hear the pain you just caused them from half the battlefield away. Bayonet someone in the neck, and they'll lay helpless on the ground gurgling their own blood. You'll see howitzers send legless bodies flying, wounded screaming men that now have only one arm, and I won't even go into flamethrowers.Pros:-Play as one of 4 members of historical squads from different nations in the war. (U.S. Doughboys, Tommies, Canadians, U.S. Marines, Schutz, etc.) Each of which have their own unique weapons and perks.-Very immersive. No other game quite matches the feeling you get when your NCO blows the whistle to go over the top like Verdun.-Multiple game modes. If you don't feel like playing the usual frontlines or don't feel like facing real people in general, you can play squad defense instead. This is a game mode where you join a squad and survive waves of AI attackers. (I'm a big fan of this game mode.)Cons:-The game still has its share of bugs. Nothing that should turn you off from the game though. One time I even saw someone pistol whip a German to death with a Lewis gun. You don't want to miss out on that hilarity.-WWI is difficult. You will die a lot. That's just a result of how the warfare was at this time.1914/1918, would charge across no man's land for the fatherland again

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'm only 4.5 hours in and I'm really starting to see the originality come out of this game. It truly is a squad based fps and if you don't stay with them you will not survive. Each member of the 4 player squad has a role and only 1 person can play as that role, but you can offer to switch rolls. One thing that really stand out to me is that you feel everyone is fighitng on one giant map. Although you technically spend the entire round in one area, it's all connected. Instead of picking a server you look at a map and select an area which then shows all the battallions situated there as well as which team is currently holding that territory. While your holding down trenches, another batallion is pushing up the line to where you team can take place. It's very difficult at first if you're used to having several items/weapons/explosives on hand. The only items available in Verdun that I've seen so far are binoculars, grenades, or a slightly more effective melee weapon such as a blade on your rifle. These are all class specific items too. Not to mention 80% of shots are 1 shot kills, although certain weapons hold very limited ammo that won't reload until completely empty either, so it's actually balanced pretty well. It really makes you think about when to take the shot. Range is insane for the rifles. It's fairly difficult / takes some time to earn a scope, but it is most certainly possible to snipe enemies from over 100m away without one (actually just got that achievement). Overall, getting a kill in this game is extremely satisfying!The graphics aren't the greatest, but it's definitely not bad. Of course, there is much optimization to be done too. The sound is well done making close by shots really put a scare in you especially because one shot will probably kill you. Animation is prob worst part, but it's easily ignored by the awesome gameplay and VERY satisfying kills. Don't take my word for it, but considering the accuracty/range of rifles I would assume this kind of game would give an advatage to those who can handle higher graphics because it means seeing enemies further away. Regardless, I think this game is absolutely great and deserves more recognition and support. To be honest though, I wouldn't have bought this game if it wasn't on sale, but I can comfortably say it's worth the full price.***Major updates & Improvements since this was orginally posted. Verdun is now preparing for an offical launch on April 28th. They've come a long way and this game is still Rad!

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												This game is a game that I have been waiting on for years. I have always wanted to play a WW1 game that focused on trench warfare and the western front. The level of detail that is put into these maps are above and beyond what other mainstream developers go to. The trenches are THE most realistic trenches I have seen in any game with the small details like covered up dead bodies laying on the ground and tiny little dug-outs for infantry to sleep. Even in the crater-filled No Man's Land I was taking cover from an enemy MG and just saw a pocket watch laying next to me. Just seeing this, I knew that the devs are really trying to get this as accurate as they can. Things likl pocket watches, spades, helmets and boots are scattered everywhere because they would be the sort of thing that would be dug up today.At times it can be confusing with all of these different soldiers most commonly on the allied side, where some soldiers are French, British or American all in one trench. Because in a game like this, you wopuld be looking out for different uniforms. So there have been a few times when I have been in an enemy trench and have turned a corner and accidently fired at a French soldier becuase their uniform almost looks like the German uniform.I absolutley love this game, if you buy this game (which you should be doing right now), definately plat the tench warfare game-mode (forgot what its called, you'll know it when you see it). This game is kind of what I was hoping BF1 would be, but BF1 didn't quite deliver on the whole trech warfare aspect.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 11
												I like First Person Shooters with iron sights. Meaning: if you shoot from the hip, you are only able to hit what is directly in front of you; if you want to hit something which is 10m away, you HAVE to aim like with a real gun.You have to use a button to get the weapon up, pointing towards the enemy and use the sights of the weapon to target.This is so much better than some cross hairs which show you where your hits will be. It feels better. Much better.Verdun is such a shooter. There are different weapons from the time of World War 1 and most kill in one hit to the body, pistols need two shots to the body, grenades are brutal and so on.If you want to run around shooting at everything and killing people like a hero, wrong game.If you want to move slowly, then climb out of your hole and run zigzag towards the next hole, the whole time praying no sniper and no MG is targeting your area, then jumping into the hole and laying on the ground and preparing for the next run, then this is your game.If you want to sit somewhere with a rifle and snipe at people who are trying to run zigzag towards your position, then this is your game.If you want to setup a Machine Gun and spray down people who try to run towards you, this is your game.Don't expect real good graphics, don't expect smooth moving, don't expect really good weapons.Even the gameplay is not really good.Everything is good enough so you can have fun and perhaps this is the kind of game you want to play from time to time.Just so you know what I think good shooters are:- Survarium - Heroes & Generals - Borderlands - Call of Duty: World at War http://store.steampowered.com/app/10090/- Call of Duty®: Black Ops II http://store.steampowered.com/app/202990/These are really good shooters. High quality.Nevertheless, this game is not bad. It is fun for a while.I have no idea what engine they are using, but it is not good for this kind of game. Or not used in a good way.If you want a FPS game with iron sights in WW1, you don't have a lot of games to select one from. I don't know of any others. If you want a game where people have to move the front, where you have to cross a killing field, where nobody is the hero, this could be it for your.If you want a really good game, don't get this. Sorry.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												First of all I own this game since the very beginnings it was released on steam, not because I anticipated it but because I got it in a good price.After that I played a couple of hours and left it there.Until now. With BF1 releasing next month and all the nostalgia for WWI surfacing again I felt the need to play a game of that era in order to fill the gap until October.But with all videos coming up and Alpha of BF1 I was like: Hell this is not WWI, this is just BF set in WWI.So is Verdun a good game?Yes it is.ProsFew maps:The maps as I said are series of trenches well placed for defence and bad for offence, most of them if captured are difficult to held like it was one hadred years ago.(it is in the pros because the maps are what they had to be and not open battlefields with snipers on buildings or hills and tanks running like hell and soldiers with machine guns on the move shooting everything). Weapons:Weapons have a variety. Single shot rifles are what you find in most classes (yes there are classes thank God) but you can also meet machine guns (Germans are op like in reality), light machine guns, assault guns, and of course melee and grenades. Classes:There are many kind of classes most of them for coordinating in game like officers who can call mortars and smoke barrage and also point attack points and defence points. Also there are kinda many classes with a bit different equipment. You want a bolt action with one grenade you can have it, you want only your rifle with fixed bayonet also you can have it. Also the classes have 3 tiers which unlock with leveling up which is easy in one way in my opinion and you can easily pick what style you like.Graphics:They are not the Alpha and the Omega in this game as many titles these days. If you look for one game with ultra nice graphics and realism like you play in real life this is not your game. I do not say they are not nice (they are fine as all the game has B+ graphics) but for those who do not want anything less than Whitcher 3 or BF1 do not buy this game.Gameplay:Really easy to learn. Shooting is easy simply because you do not have to deal with fast objects and targets but when you learn to shoot correctly you get kills. What I do not know and can not really say is if there is bullet distance meter or instant kill when you shoot (I will look and report my findings). Connectivity:It is oversimple. You pick what you like in any map you like. If there is available position you go right into, if not it is easy either with trade or if the position is empty later on you switch. SO you do not like being an officer with just a hand gun and want a machine gun? trade or wait a couple of minutes. Also i never faced lagg problem, I play in an average 70ping which is good.ConsNo bullet drop. Something inserted in games from battlefield and it stays there. One AAA title, this is simpler game. See, shoot, XP earned.Not AAA graphics (for those who desperately feel a game must have them in order to feel satisfaction)Well for epiloge Verdun is a game of 20$ for giving you an enjoying War experience with good classes, fine maps, good shooting (basic tip, learn to say the differnce between a tree and an enemie). Really I can not see why not buy such a game especially if it goes in Sales.9,5/10PS: if you are camping animals with a sniper rifle I will love to find you on the battlefield... You are as good as dead... someone will figure out your position and will just chat it in the team. You see the next target and you goin for the kill? Nope, you will just gettin hammered with machine guns and mortars... Also you can not snipe properly in this game...

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												This game is like sniping in the battlefield series, but better and in a realistic ww1 setting. It's something I really enjoy, but it's difficult and I'd say it certainly isn't for everyone. If you're looking for a fast-paced run-n-gun, this is not that. The action is in the intensity of the trench combat and finding a sniper hiding out across the map. It's slow, it's hard, and by god, I love it all. The community is also one of the best I have ever been a part of, and that's a HUGE plus for me, since I like to talk to people while I play.

content:
Posted: January 30
												This game is great for an independent developer. This game may have a few quirks and goofy movements, but overall it is excellent. A fun multiplayer with very accurate weapons and uniforms as well as maps. The game still updating an dadding new squads and hopefully more features soon. As i said, some glitches need to be solved but its nothing too big. The #1 complaint that i, and many other player shave, is sniper scopes. A few updates changed it and made them a bit useless and hard to use. Overall this game is great and i highly recommend it. With great graphics, sounds, maps, historically accurate, and instead of witty loading hints it gives you facts about WWI, which i personally thought was cool.Just to be a historian Nazi, the game says "Verdun 1914-1918". NONE of this game can take place in 1914 as gas masks were not used in WWI until 1916. Gas was used in 1914 and the onyl way the troops survived was by breathing in rags which were soaked in urine.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												Verdun is a game that really aims to be a realistic depiction of how war was fought during WW1. I think in that respect it succeeds brilliantly. This is trench warfare as it really must have been: - waiting around for the enemy, and then getting shot in the head from somewhere you never saw coming. - going "over the top" of the trench on command of your squad leader, and getting mowed down almost instantly.- Capturing an area, only to be hammered with chemical gasses- putting on your gas mask, obstructing your visibility so you can hardly see where (or who) you are shooting.The gameplay is brutal and unforgiving, but hey, this is war! I love how the game doesn't make it "arcady" or easy. This makes it all the more rewarding when you get to kill someone. The graphics and lighting are really nice too, being nice and muddy in the trenches, but has a good selection of more colorfull maps as well. If you are not afraid of a challenge, I recommend it!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
Lovely game and great maps, weapons and characters!The maps are very raw and unforgiving when it comes to the combat, the core tactic is to keep your head down and advance through the trenches.There are two gamemodes as of now,- Deathmatch, pick a rifle and spawn somewhere on the map and combat with up to 16 other players. Fast paced and very good to learn the weapons and maps.- "Squad Combat", two teams where each team is built up on multiple squads. Each squad has it's own theme and abilities and this needs to be taken into account when playing a map since too many of one squad can be bad for the outcome of the match.SquadsThere are different types of squad in the game, each one has their own playstyle. Some are based on calling in mortar strikes or gas, some are recon based and some are more offensive. The right mix of these really makes the matches more enjoyable!One thing though...Only downside at the moment is that there are too many players picking the "Squad Combat" mode and playing it as if it was deathmatch, which sucks for the players who want to play the mode as it was intended to be played. This can result in some salty chat and boring experience but most of the time the matches go on and hopefully the players change their playstyle to fit the mode!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												Aug 5, 2014: When I first got this game, I tried playing it with my friend and everything went wrong. It kept kicking me out of the round for no reason, we couldn't add each other as friends (which we still can't do, please fix this), finding each other's squad to join was very hard, and the gameplay was absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥ It would run at 5 fps at best and everything was really glitchy and ♥♥♥♥ed up. HOWEVER, I then tried to play the game again several days later by myself, and everything worked perfectly. Obviously I didn't have to worry about making my squad and having my friend try to find it, but I was able to join right in without being randomly kicked, the gameplay was very smooth and ran at about 40 fps, and there weren't really any glitches, other than when you duck down, you can still get shot and killed sometimes, but it's immediately, so it's understandable, but still annoying. When this game is working, it is VERY fun to play and a really cool WW1 simulator, however, there are still several things that need to be worked on in order for it to be even better. As of right now, I give it a 7/10.UPDATE:June 30, 2016: After about two years of playing this game, I have seen it go through many different stages, have seen many bugs patched, and have certainly seen hard work and dedication to the game by the devs. They have added in so many new weapons, squads, abilities, and gameplay mechanics and I could not be happier with my purchase of this game, back when it was in early alpha. The dev team for Verdun has been one of the best dev teams for any game I have played, and the game itself really sucks you into a pretty accurate representation of The Great War. Not only is it historically accurate, for the most part, but the way they make the teams switch on and off from counter attacks, defending, retreating, and advancing gives it a lot of depth and keeps the combat fun and enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes mil-sims, even though this isn't a full on simulator, and anyone who is a big world war enthusiast. It could still use some bug patches and what not, but it is almost entirely perfect at this point in time. I would now give it a solid 9.5/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2016
												Without any competition, Verdun is the best and only WWI shooter on the market.But it has legs and will probably stand up to whatever may come in the future.Remember that wall of a difficulty curve in Red Orchestra (a comparably realistic shooter experience)?That doesn't happen here.Sure, you have it tough in the beginning, but after you get to grips with a few of the maps and realise that you need to keep your noggin down, you end up pulling your weight pretty fast.It's got a good amount of maps, a varied series of tactics to be employed in conquering trenches, some working better than others depending upon the map, and you have every chance of killing a level 100 vet even as a level 1 grunt.Le good:The attention to detail is amazing.Squadding up with friends is a blast and a half, it really gets you into the moment.There's variety in weapons/roles/squads.The weapons feel satisfying.Graphic representations of every projectile that flies around lets you see mortar shots incoming, muzzle flashes, bullet trajectories.Le bad:Takes a while to get used to targetting, especially in close combat.Mesh issues still pop up once in a while, prompting you to get stuck in texture.A few bugs still arise and cause you to teleport 50 metres across the map with little to no warning.All in all, the bad things about this game are mostly technical issues, which are slowly but surely being taken care of by the devs who are pouring their heart into this.If you want a realistic, historical, atmospheric, tense shooter that tackles The Great War, this one's for you.And if people give you flak about it feeling contrived because you get executed for deserting, they probably know ♥♥♥♥ all about WWI - don't mind 'em, send 'em back to school and get 'em to brush up on their history.This is the best and most realistic depiction of a war in a game, shooter or otherwise.P.S. alright, alright, there's no friendly fire. Sorry. Deal with it, eh?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'm going to give my review of the game after spending 6 straight hours playing it.This game is a breath of fresh air. Why you may ask? Because of the core mechanic of the game: Trench warfare. The system of attacking and defending the trenches makes this the best paced multiplayer shooters I have ever played. Thats why I played it for 6 straight hours! It gives this game no stale moment. As soon as you might get bored defending your trench, its time to rush and attack the enemy's.The issue I hear the most is with the net code. No its not perfect. Yes every once in a while you will get shot behind a corner or miss someone you should have got. This is very frustrating and something that must be changed, but at least for me, not a common sight. After looking through the forums and asking a few questions myself, it is clear the devs care about the game. I have no doubt that the net code will get better with time.Please don't let this game pass you by. If you enjoy tactical shooters without the slugishness that usually accompanies them, get this game. However if you are looking for a finished product, wait until the game is release and check it out again.Current rating: 7/10

content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												Verdun is a first person shooter (FPS) which places you in the trenches of the first world war (yes, the one 1914 to 1918).This FPS tries to be on the realistic side of things. Meaning that running, getting hit, amount of ammo, type of rifles and additions to them, etc. are rather accurate to setting.It only offers infantry (there are no vehicules of any kind, at least that I know of).You can either fight in some sort of PvE mode which makes you fight off waves of enemies with up to four other players or you can play the first person shooter mode against all human players in rather big battles.With your progress (kill enemies and aquire targets, etc) you earn experience points which add up to rank. With each rank you receive some sort of...well...coins or points. With those you can unlock weapons, weapon sets and weapon additions.It is certainly no Call of Duty or Battlefield (especially considering the announced new one), Verdun is more on the realistic side and not as fast paced. If there is a need to comparison, then Red Orchestra is certainly closer to Verdun while Arma 3 (beside of the setting, of course) might be even a bit more "realistic" (in terms of simulation).I'd say that this game is most definitly worth a try when you like first person shooter which either are not evolving around fast paced rounds or lots of blood and not too terribly much on the simulation side.

												Awesome game. Good balance of realism and gameplay. Love the variety of units and weapons, and I love the fact that one or two shots put a guy down. I also like that the vast majority of soldiers are running around with rifles, and it's not some arcadey game where everyone runs around with MGs.Machine guns are powerful but tricky to use well. Maps are gorgeous and really feel like hellish trenches and crater-strewn terrain.Definitely would recommend this game. Ends up feeling kind of like insurgency, but in WWI. There's a distinct lack of WWI games out there, and this one definitely fills that niche well

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
												Verdun is a first person shooter placed directly in World War One on the Western Front. I must say that overall it is a very solid game, but it does require a powerful computer. Each game consists of one side that attacks the other side's trench, and if successful, captures it, and now must defend it; however, if they fail, then the defending side counter-attacks, and et cetera. People connect in squads of four; the leader of this squad can call down gas and mortar strikes. The graphics are high-quality, and the game itself follows true to the actual events of World War One. However, I must warn you that if you aren't very good at sniping, this might not be the game for you if you are the one playing defense.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												One of the best, most atmospheric, and scary war shooters ever created.I'm going to do a list of pro's and cons.+ Beautifully done game+ One of, if not THE BEST war atmospheres ever created.+ Very nice graphical fidelity+ Realistic weapon damage output. You don't need to shoot someone 5 or 6 times.+ Updated gun sounds make them sound more "powerful"+++ Trench warfare+  Multiple types of Chemical gas + The gas mask makes you feel crowded. Aiming becomes difficult, vision becomes obscured, and you can hear yourself breathing heavily through it.+ Buy this game right now.- Bullet registry. Sometimes you dive into cover, but you'll die after you're behind it. This is a LOT better than it was a few months ago.- At long distances, ofen through a sniper scope, textures can become completely smudged, or dissappear completely. This is such a minor thing however, as all of the pros outweigh it by so much.As you can see, there is MANY more PRO'S than cons. I would 120% recommend this game to any of my friends.

												Not only are WWI games rare, but Verdun is a damn good one.The thing about this game that truly makes it stand out in my eyes is the sheer brutality of it. (You'll need to turn the gore setting to ULTRA to experience this.)Imagine you're a British soldier on the front lines. You glance over the top of the trench and see a German hard charging toward you. You squeeze a shot off and Gerry drops about 20 meters in front of your trench. As you chamber a new round in your rifle, you hear the soldier you just shot let out a bloodcurdling scream. You wait for more to arrive, and the screaming has only gotten louder. This isn't a low-pitched scream of a large man, this is the scream of someone very young, probably not even in his 20's yet. Eventually, he succumbs to his wounds and the screaming ceases.Verdun has something that a lot of shooters lack, the dying. Take Call of Doots: You shoot someone, they die, you move on. Then you have Verdun: You gut shoot someone and you can hear the pain you just caused them from half the battlefield away. Bayonet someone in the neck, and they'll lay helpless on the ground gurgling their own blood. You'll see howitzers send legless bodies flying, wounded screaming men that now have only one arm, and I won't even go into flamethrowers.Pros:-Play as one of 4 members of historical squads from different nations in the war. (U.S. Doughboys, Tommies, Canadians, U.S. Marines, Schutz, etc.) Each of which have their own unique weapons and perks.-Very immersive. No other game quite matches the feeling you get when your NCO blows the whistle to go over the top like Verdun.-Multiple game modes. If you don't feel like playing the usual frontlines or don't feel like facing real people in general, you can play squad defense instead. This is a game mode where you join a squad and survive waves of AI attackers. (I'm a big fan of this game mode.)Cons:-The game still has its share of bugs. Nothing that should turn you off from the game though. One time I even saw someone pistol whip a German to death with a Lewis gun. You don't want to miss out on that hilarity.-WWI is difficult. You will die a lot. That's just a result of how the warfare was at this time.1914/1918, would charge across no man's land for the fatherland again

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'm only 4.5 hours in and I'm really starting to see the originality come out of this game. It truly is a squad based fps and if you don't stay with them you will not survive. Each member of the 4 player squad has a role and only 1 person can play as that role, but you can offer to switch rolls. One thing that really stand out to me is that you feel everyone is fighitng on one giant map. Although you technically spend the entire round in one area, it's all connected. Instead of picking a server you look at a map and select an area which then shows all the battallions situated there as well as which team is currently holding that territory. While your holding down trenches, another batallion is pushing up the line to where you team can take place. It's very difficult at first if you're used to having several items/weapons/explosives on hand. The only items available in Verdun that I've seen so far are binoculars, grenades, or a slightly more effective melee weapon such as a blade on your rifle. These are all class specific items too. Not to mention 80% of shots are 1 shot kills, although certain weapons hold very limited ammo that won't reload until completely empty either, so it's actually balanced pretty well. It really makes you think about when to take the shot. Range is insane for the rifles. It's fairly difficult / takes some time to earn a scope, but it is most certainly possible to snipe enemies from over 100m away without one (actually just got that achievement). Overall, getting a kill in this game is extremely satisfying!The graphics aren't the greatest, but it's definitely not bad. Of course, there is much optimization to be done too. The sound is well done making close by shots really put a scare in you especially because one shot will probably kill you. Animation is prob worst part, but it's easily ignored by the awesome gameplay and VERY satisfying kills. Don't take my word for it, but considering the accuracty/range of rifles I would assume this kind of game would give an advatage to those who can handle higher graphics because it means seeing enemies further away. Regardless, I think this game is absolutely great and deserves more recognition and support. To be honest though, I wouldn't have bought this game if it wasn't on sale, but I can comfortably say it's worth the full price.***Major updates & Improvements since this was orginally posted. Verdun is now preparing for an offical launch on April 28th. They've come a long way and this game is still Rad!

								for such a small game Verdun has suprisingly become one of my favorite fps games. Now I have only played the game for six ours(at the time of this review being written) but in this short amount of time Verdun keeps on impressing me. Their are two game modes one is free-for-all and the other is front line mode. In front line mode you either start out attacking or defending a trench. The game continues to deliver fun fast paced action every match. One time when defending a trench I found cover and started to shoot french soldiers charging the trench. One by one they continued to fall down until the trench was secured. Another time two of my teamates were pinned down so I went thru the trench we were attacking and when I got to the spot where the enemies were I Just started to line up the shot and took four guys out. The only negatives I could find about this game are that their can be lag there is a limited amount of weapons and their are no unlockable items (so far). Besides that I definitely recomend this game to anyone who likes fps games.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
												Verdun - the best game about First World War since... ehm... hmm. This game proved that "boring" and "monotonous" trench warfare can be bloody fun. War is hell. You hear your commander whistle, you jump off the trench, you see your buddies run straight into chlorine cloud. Your squadmate tries to put on gas mask and misses the barbed wire, gets entangled in it. Your other friend turns to him, looks, thinks about helping him, but gets nailed with an enemy bullet. French, British, American, German, Canadian, Belgian... No man's land is just a giant mincer, chopping off your lives short. You see how people in front of you get mowed, running straight into machine gun crossfire. You have a split second to decide: do I crouch and turn back? Maybe I can get through? You are wrong. You will never get through. And even if by some miracle you make it to the enemy trench, you'll get ambushed by a rifleman, hiding behind a barrel. As the time goes, you'll see young soldiers become veterans with waxed moustaches, ready to die for their Fatherland. But is it really worth fighting?If you start thinking about it all, you might miss the command to retreat. The next thing you see is your lifeless body flying away, while the mortars hammer your position. Unless you affix your bayonet and charge your enemy, how dare you claim to know anything about true dirt and pain of virtual warfare? Get immersed into this painful world of war, and remember lads: It's a long long way to Tipperary

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												I know people are hating on Battlefield 1 but people need to understand that Battlefield is its own series.  Verdun is very good, it's funny sometimes and almost always fun to play and looks fairly good for what it's worth, but it is the most realistic setting WW1 game out there.  Yes, it takes team tactics to win and yes, it can be slow at times but that only mirrors the real WW1 because the truth is, WW1 was not the most interesting war to have ever taken place.  That being said, Battlefield is a cinematic movie-looking FPS series that's changed little over time: it's meant to be fast paced, it's meant to be fun, and yes, it's meant to be a little unrealistic if that means the game will be more fun overall.  Don't get me wrong, I love Verdun, but sometimes I get the feeling that it's so realistic that it's never going to be as fun as a game like Battlefield 1 will be, to me at least.  Just because two games focus on WW1 doesn't mean they have to be the same game, and doesn't mean they both have to be hyper-realistic to satisfy all the manchilds out there complaining about Battlefield 1.  So if you want to immerse yourself in the WW1 atmosphere, if you want to get to know the guns/areas and factions and whatnot before Battlefield 1 comes out, by all means get this game.  Don't expect it to be super action-packed cinematic goodness, because it's not.  This is more of a simulator than what I think of as a FPS but like I said it's still very good.  Don't expect this to be Battlefield 1, and don't expect Battlefield 1 to be like Verdun when it comes out later this year.  I love Verdun, but I'm really looking forward to playing a fast-paced fun WW1 game that's willing to sacrifice some realistic-ness in the name of making a fun game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2016
												The Good: This isn't your normal first person shooter where you can run around on your own and rack up the points. Sure, you can do that in Verdun, but it won't get you anywhere very far. The gameplay is based around solid team work and good communication, something you don't normally expect to see worked into fps games often. It makes for an enjoyable and satisfying gameplay in a time setting that is not explored through games very well, but the sounds, guns, and different maps really put you feel like you're in the Great War, hunkering down trying to avoid bullets and artillery, and then sprinting to the enemy trench to take out the enemy. The Bad: There isn't really anything terrible that I have encountered yet in Verdun. I suppose one improvement I can suggest for the developers, however, is to somehow implement a tank or two on the battlefield, a major part of the war. You are able to use a lot of new "modern" weaponry in the game like grenades, machine guns, submachine guns, gas, and even planes, but no tanks. The team balancing sytem is a nice and welcome touch, but sometimes the game is too lopsided and things can turn south every game. Not sure exactly how to better that. In summary, it's a fun and creative WW1 fps. If you're looking for a different type of shooting game, I'd recommend this one.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
												100 year anniversary of the battle of Verdun might as well do a review. Game is pretty awesome, highly recommend it. Not for run and gun shooter fans, this game takes patience, intelligence and team work. Each match plays like King of the Hill with a series of trenches, where one side defends and the other side attacks. If attackers take the defenders trench within the time limit (I think 5 minutes) then the timer is reset, and defending team has to retake their trench, if they fail to do so then they retreat to the next trench behind them. Eventually one side is either pushed too far back to their last trench, or the overall game timer runs out and the side who captured to most trenches win. The Squad system is pretty interesting, but with some issues. There are multiple squad types each having different rolls, and thus having different soldier types available, but most people play using the German Landers, French Poilues, or British Tommes squad types because they have the most streight forward soldier types in their squad; An officer who uses a pistol by default but can level up to have a rifle and can call in artillery, a Rifleman who can upgrade to be a sniper, A machine gunner who can use a machine gun (go figure), or a Grenadier who carries a lot of grenades.Apparently the squads themselves level up but from my experience once you create a squad there’s no way to find it when you stop playing and come back later. Usually I find myself joining free spots on existing squads anyway, so take this bit with a grain of salt. Overall a pretty cool Objective FPS that you can play with friends or by your self. Pros:-Great First Person Shooter, very tactical heavy requiring teamwork, brains and patience. -Straight forward role system that unlocks as you level up. -Various maps that have different challenges as you try to fight through them. -Non Toxic player community that is actually pleasent to banter with in the chat. Cons:-Player population very, sometimes its hard to get into a server, other times its deserted. -Wonky Animations, but they're still working on it. -Some LOD issues with terrain where you can sometimes see players through objects like sandbags or obstacles that are far away.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												Ill start by saying this is not COD, so that should be grounds enough to give this a try. PROS:1) realism mechanics: stuck on barbed wire, being gassed, suppresive fire, cardio endurance, must not rush and key jam      while reloading or you will not seat your bolt properly, if you get shot 9/10 times you will die. no sprinting with MGs.2) leadership: in Verdun leadership plays an important role and pushes team play. The NCOs have special abilitys to call in artillery, gas, recon planes and such in order to assist in the battle; making them priceless if used effectively. NCOs can also mark where to focus an attack making it easier to maneuver on the battlefield.3) this game isnt made by your top tier shooter developers so the focus is more about how they care about the game they made and less about how can i nickle and dime my market then move on to the next turd.4) its the only WW1 shooter I know of making it basically an untouched market and I feel anyone would have a hard time making this better overall without more realism mechanics such as first aid application, wounds that bleed out and such.5) the game is very affordable and there are no in game purchases6) THERE IS NO GORE PPPPLEASE ADD GORE or atleast a setting to choose to have it on if you wish.CONS: 1)There arent alot of maps to choose from, although the ones that we do have are not bad (they are providing a free update/expansion with new maps and some other stuff very soon)2) sometimes you will be so sure there is no conceivable way you missed that shot, maybe due to lag but it usualy ends with you being dead and wondering...how?3) no uniform selectable uniform/appearance changes ( you will get new uniforms as your squad progresses but only during that game, once you leave its gone),4) I want to loot corpses for ammo/grenades, and use the enemy firearms if i find one on the battlefield i like better.5) MGs could use some tweaking, they do have limitations but overall i feel they are much too powerful and i dont think you should be able to hip fire a couple of those beasts.thats all i have for now, over all it is a great game for what it is. it can be frustrating but usually its because you are trying to rush ahead like youre playing black ops II. take your time, play the game like a troll trench camper because thats what WWI was. buy it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												After about a solid 100 hours in the game and im still rather a new comer to the title I feel like I can write a solid review about verdun. If your looking for a flashback of simpler times where your skill, accuracy, and timing were rewarded this may be the game for you. Growing up I would spend countless hours on cod, cod2 and all the medal of honors. Although this game is set in ww1 the core mechanics of playing verdun seem very familiar and almost nostalgic to me. The weapons are simple, upgrades make sense, squad work is essential, and everyone has their role. Objectives are very simple and are a constant tug and pull style frontlines that are pretty realistic for the time period. Maps are well designed and balanced for the most part and utilization of cover and map placement is the key to sucess in the frontlines. Graphics are impressive and youll only have a few glitchy textures at far distance but that varies from rig to rig. Sounds are pretty good aside from a few stale sounding explosions (artillery and grenades will kill you alot) but im sure theyll add more. The Historical accuracy of this game was a thing the developers took seriously and it shows, Im a huge history buff and I haven't really noticed anything a miss. The thing that is this games selling point is literally its price at only 22.99USD you can't go wrong with this game and its still in beta with a steady supply of new content. The only real downside is the games small player base or community. Late at night you'll often find it difficult to find full matches even when changing servers EU, JP, ASIA, AUS.  But im sure the games community will only grow from here.

												The historical accuracy in this game is simply wonderful, a dedicated team of developers have obviously devoted a large amount of time to Verdun and still are devoting it! The Eastern Front has been promised as a future expansion and even the game as it is now is simply great. Charging over the top of your own trench into a hail of machine- gun fire, a downpour of artillery shelling and (of course) barbed wire certainly is very captivating. I can definately and confidently give Verdun 10/10 and it is probably the best game I have ever played.

content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
												I love verdun, you meet all sorts of funny, and nice people, who just want to blow your brains out. I had the most interesting experience ever on Verdun. Now you may ask "what happened?", well I'll tell you. It was a small lobby of about 6, we had just finished the last match, when we loaded into a new map (dun dun dunnn). At this point, there where 3 of us left on the lobby, and two of us were constantly dying from suicide (according to the game). The other player ;eft the lobby after his 10th death. but i refused to go out like this!, suddenly the remaining user (who hasnt died from suicide) tells me that he has a away to restore my terrain, and I said "how?". The man replied " I can rstore your terrain, IF you answer me this. I reply shivering with fear "Okay?", the man simply said "Do you like Fish Sticks?". And as I contemplated whether or not I truly did enjoy the seafood of question, I quickly said yes to get my terrain back. The man says "So your a gay fish?" and my terrain was restored. Still to this day I think back to that horrible match the end.

content:
Posted: January 30
												This game is great for an independent developer. This game may have a few quirks and goofy movements, but overall it is excellent. A fun multiplayer with very accurate weapons and uniforms as well as maps. The game still updating an dadding new squads and hopefully more features soon. As i said, some glitches need to be solved but its nothing too big. The #1 complaint that i, and many other player shave, is sniper scopes. A few updates changed it and made them a bit useless and hard to use. Overall this game is great and i highly recommend it. With great graphics, sounds, maps, historically accurate, and instead of witty loading hints it gives you facts about WWI, which i personally thought was cool.Just to be a historian Nazi, the game says "Verdun 1914-1918". NONE of this game can take place in 1914 as gas masks were not used in WWI until 1916. Gas was used in 1914 and the onyl way the troops survived was by breathing in rags which were soaked in urine.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2016
												Verdun is a pretty unique shooter and very well made, but the trailers and screenshots are horribly misleading. You won't be running and gunning, players aren't going to charge forward...it's mostly just lying down or crouching in a hole, slowly moving up and then slowly retreating. It's extremely slow paced and yet there's no tension unlike similar "realistic" shooters like Insurgency. There are no "clutch" moments, or brief surges of action.The maps are pretty dull to look at as they're mostly just holes in the dirt surrounded by barbed wire and wooden fences...realistic, but pretty boring to play. Sound design is good. Gunplay is okay but hit detection seems a bit off at times. The game seems to be optimised well for lower-end systems, as even my aging laptop could run it smoothly with no issues.I can see the appeal and if you're interested World War 1 or slow-paced shooters, I can recommend Verdun. It's unlike anything else on the market and I'm sure there are people out there who love it. I'm just not one of them!

												This game is not like other first person shooters. This is Verdun.I bought this game during the summer sales just because i liked the idea of a WW1 first person shooter, and oh boy have i fallen in love with Verdun. Its all about getting killed during the first couple of hours playing, no matter if you stay in the trenches, crawl through the no-man's-land or attack straight away. These first hours may demotivate new players due to the steep learning curve, but i advise to keep trying and dieing, as the payoff will be great. Everyone should just play this game to experience the horrors of WW1, nothing can describe the feeling of jumping in an enemy trench amidst a gas cloud, sight greatly reduced by your gas mask, and not sure whether you will get stabbed, shot, blown up or if you yourself might stumble upon some unawara Frenchies.Pros:- One shot kills. Don't miss or you're dead.- Graphics- Historical accuracy- Teamplay- Community- New content on regular basis- ...Cons:- Difficulty at start- 16 vs 16 maps, would prefer 32vs32 or 64vs64

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 14, 2015
												Verdun is a fantastic world war 1 FPS. It's incredibly immersive and the trench combat is difficult but very rewarding.  Imagine running through no man's land with artillery shells going off all around you, you make a dash for the enemy trench and jump in. You look around you and get your bearings, while you hear frantic shouting in multiple languages and accents. Are those footsteps around the corner? It's hard to tell with the deafening explosions, you get up and walk slowly towards the corner, arm outstretched with a webley revolver tightly gripped in your hand. You see a shadow and then quickly a man, you fire wildly and a stray shot hits him in the neck and he slumps down. You issue an order for your squad to advance to your position. You stand up and very carefully try to peek over the side of the winding trench to spot the enemies hidden further up. You hear a noise like a fly buzzing past your ear, then one that sounds like a pebble hitting concrete. You slump down, dead. This is the great war. This is Verdun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
												I held my hands over my head as artillery shells exploded around my trench. Dazed, I staggered forward, one goal in mind. "Defend the trench!" my mantra repeated, beating a tattoo into my consciousness. I reached my pillbox. Crouching, I blew my whistle. My men soon came to the pillbox, posting up around me. Shots rang from my gunner as he killed another enemy. "All clear!" I slowly raised myself until I could see out of the makeshift window. I saw movement in some of the underbrush. I called in a mortar shot on that position. Crouching again, I waited, each passing second an eternity. ...........A small hiss rose into earshot. I wondered what it meant as my gunner shouted "Grenade!" The word was not even out of his mouth as a bright flash errupted just outside of the pillbox entrance. I was knocked senseless. Two things crossed my mind as I faded into darkness; my family, and how I would never see them again, and my joy as I heard my mortar shell strike home. The screams of my enemies became a lullaby as I drifted into oblivion.10/10This fps shooter is unlike any I have ever played. Set in WWI era, the bolt action rifle is king. Trenches are your castles, your lives, your tombs. You leave a trench, you die. You stand up, you die. You run zig-zag patterns towards the enemy trench, you die. Somewhere along the way, you start to put everything together. Killing gets easier. You develop a sense of danger, you learn to spot patterns. You discover how close of an ally patience is. Patience leads you to survival, and ultimately, your victory. Pros:-Realistic ballistics-Good balancing-Great bonuses for team playersCons:-No story mode (not complaining about this, just a head's up for players who are looking for some sort of story/campaign.Give it a go. It's definitely worth it.

												If you have a thing for realism in your shooters, grittiness, squad based tactics, and enjoy a challenge, you'll enjoy Verdun.Once you get the feel for this game, it's intensity will have you hooked! content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												First of all, I want to say, that I bought this game during the early access alpha.After I stopped playing it back then because of problems like the horrible performance, my rank getting reset (after reaching level 60) and some the changes to the deathmatch, this week was the first time I tried it out again and I have to say that it has become a fantastic game!The Frontlines mode is by far the most realistic experience I have had in a long time. In some aspects it is just like Red Orchestra 2 during WW1.Nearly all guns are one hit kill and there are dynamic waves of attacks you have to carry out or fight off.If you do not play as a team, you will die and die and die some more times...If you do play as a team, you will have to use gas, mortars etc. to advance and capture the enemy trenches.After all i can say that this game has come a long way and will continue to do so! It is one of the most realistic FPS already, but I can see it becoming even better, since the developers have prooved their abilities in the past development already!If you are looking for a realistic, brutal, historical WW1 FPS, this is your game! 10/10 would by again, even for more money!

												This game is rather amazing.It's quick to learn and hard to master.The realism adds so much weight to the combat that it has me constantly coming back for more.The first time I saw that far off gray streak in the sky I thought it was perhaps just a graphical glitch on my side... a moment later, after running in no man's land, I see it begin to break up a bit... then I watched as the pieces began to arch downward... this was artillery fire, and the realization of that stunned me in the moment...In short, I was blown away.And it was a brilliant experience!If you are looking for a hardcore and yet also casual FPS, with realism that may even give you PTSD, you might just unbelievably enjoy this. :)

content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								I started playing this about a year ago in June or so and was very impressed with how it played and how intense it was even through the bugs and funny animation. One of my favorite updates was the improved Rag-doll effect and since I usually play as Landsers NCO it is fun to watch the little French men fly up in the air after an Artillery Strike. The game kept improving a lot with the sound effects, animation and general design and feel getting better. I liked how nice and small the community was when I started and I felt a bond with other players who I've met. Now with a much larger and growing community, the game is truly starting to feel like a WWI game with massive numbers coming towards you.This game relies heavily on cooperation and pulling off strategic attacks. It really becomes better as time grows on and I like how the Squad Progression works out as it makes you want to play with friends more often and to be your best.My tip in playing NCO is to get near the enemy trench (if you're offence) and try your best to survive, find a nice hiding place inside the trench if possible, this will allow your teammates to spawn near you and make it easier to clear the trench.I'm probably the only or the few in game named "Erwin Rommel" if you want to find me to ask for tips or to just play together. I'm usually the NCO in any German Squad.*Edit: I should also add, I am not sure if it's the game's animation or just my internet that usually shows the enemy aiming at completely different area when he's actually aiming at you.

Lags are becoming a respectable problem in this game also (and not only because of ping), and the amount of people playing it is dropping. Those things I mentioned really make me sad, becasue THIS GAME IS f**KING AWESOME!!!!! Verdun manages to recreate the Trench War style without making it boring, and in a way it's hard to get mad when you die (and you WILL die, and A LOT of times). And trust me, I rage a lot in games. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2016
												I am not a FPS guy by any measure. However, Verdun has to be the most engrossing and entertaining FPS game I have ever played. It is quick, fun, brutal and to be honest the community are good too. Verdun. Well you have to work as a team, doing so has huge benefits, each team member fills a specialisation which has both strengths and weaknesses. Even after all the hours I have played I still want to play more. The designer has made significant improvements to the game and expanded it cleverly. The new nations and units types are very good and make the game even more playable. The new maps are great with no map being exactly the same and requiring different loads outs for they type of combat distinct to that map.    It is worth every cent you pay. So if your up for bolt action rifle shoot outs at anything from 300m to 1m and bayonet fights then try this its awesome. Remember its not when you die in Verdun its all about how many times. Keep your head down.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												So I was just chilling. Then I thought I should advance, so me and my trusty scoped Kar-89 ran over to the next piece of cover. Then, a few minutes later, I saw that my team was falling back. I turned around and ran towards them. The guy next to me was killed immediately after I started running, and following that the guy in front of me. I kept running while thinking "Why is it me that made it? Why did I have to live when all those other guys died?"Then it came to me. A bullet. A bullet hit me. And I was there with everyone else.And then in heaven the Lord gave me a Steam gift card and I played this.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
												A great objective based FPS. If you're obsessed with your KD ratio, it's probably not the game for you,  you'll be screamed at. Focus on the objectives do your job and everything will be fine. When you find a good team to play with, it really shines, each "class" has a unique role that it has to fill otherwise everything becomes way harder for the rest of the squad. WW1 weaponry allows for a different gameplay, compared to all the other machine gun focused modern/WW2 FPS there are.There is a progression system, however it's not central to the game experience, it rewards different play styles and doesn't impose itself on the main game.I'm having a lot of fun, the only downsize is when your team sucks or Yells at each other, but that's something all multiplayer games have in common.

Early Access Review
								One of the best World War I multiplayer squad games I have played. This game lets you choose your side, German Reich, or French Army, (two different divisions, with different classes and weapons), and let's you choose your class two! Without going into detail, There's a squad leader that has a pistol and binoculars, a rifleman, that has a basic rifle, bayonet, and sometimes a pistol, a Machine Gunner, with one of those really old WW1 LMGs, and a Grenadier, which has a basic rifle, and two grenades (frag grenades, or stielhandgrenades)

												Verdun pisses me off. I die constantly, rarely kill anyone, and frequently curse the lack of an aiming reticle, regeneration of health, or any of a number of modern shooter conveniences we take for granted.That's also why I love Verdun.Modelled after WWI-era trench fighting, the devs tried to capture the authenticity of the period - tactics, the way weapons handled, etc - as closely as possible, and it's a niche you didn't know needed filling until you play it. This is really an amazing game, especially if you think you're really good at shooters. It will humble anyone quickly, then rebuild them.Seriously, I don't even like shooters that much, and this game hooked me. That's how good it is. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Verdun is a first-person WW1 trench 'simulator' in a way. The way the game works, is that there is 2 modes, though the other mode is never really played. The first one is Capture, where you can play as the Central and Entrente Power's infantrymen in an abundance of trenches in which players have two phases. Attack, and Defend. The funnest part of the game, is just running with your fellow soldiers into battle, watching them die side-by-side, as a gas mortar strikes the enemy trench, either dispersing or killing them all. I really suggest you play this game only for Capture, as Free For All is never really played by anyone, other than all the gameplay it does showcase some realism with it's physics engine, and a beautiful graphics update. *Thanks Dev's!*

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
Product received for free
												Verdun is amazing, although it has mediocre graphics and sound - the gameplay is amazing. As what I believe to be the only WWI FPS, Verdun does not need a competitor, unless you want a more arcadey feel, like a Call of Duty title. The gameplay is very interesting, it covers a small sector of a front, with a max of 32 players. Different squads have different weapons and abilities and are able to voice chat with each other. Some can call in gas while others call in recon planes. It is skill based and there are no OP unlocks, just weapons good if used right. A shovel or knife is great at clearing out a trench, while a machine gun can kill an entire wave of retreating enemies. One of my only complaints on the actual quality of the gameplay is how lax the balancing system is. It asks "can you please switch to Axis/Entente powers to make the game balanced" If nobody wants to switch it will stay that way the entire game. If it were up to me the squad with the fewest people on the overpowered team should be disbanded and sent to the other team. Another problem is the amount of U.S. squads, there needs to be a limit, because everyone spams the U.S. Marines, even though they're terrible and have nothing good, because they're American. Either remove one or both of the U.S. Squads or put in a system to limit the amount of U.S. squads. The British, French and Belgians won the war, not the U.S.Overall, Verdun is a solid game with great gameplay, but with  squad and team balance issues and the graphics and sound are meh. I'd give it a 7.5/10 Definitely buy this if you enjoy WWI or want something a little new to play.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
												This game is hard as hell. You need to be crouched or prone at all times or else you'll get shot by a sniper. And if you think you can take more than one bullet, oh no. This aint no CoD or Battlefield; one bullet from a rifle and you're dead. And just to make matters worse, half the time you don't even know what killed you.Despite this, it's really fun. Teamwork is pretty damn important, so you'll want to get some friends. Because of how much you'll die, it's even more rewarding to finally get a kill after getting shot and blown up five times in a row. Every weapon also feels great. Each one feels powerful, heavy, and packs a blow. Really, all this game needs is bots, 64 player support, and a crapton of more maps, and it'll be perfecto.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								Ladies and Gentlemen of Steam, I rarely, if ever do this when I write a review. But, I am going to whole heartily recommend this game!I do not know what else to say about this game, aside from, THIS is exactly the way a WWI FPS should work. The thing that carries this game forward is the system they have worked out for the "Tug of War" aspect of trench warfare. That alone, the innovative game type, is enough reason to pick this up.For those who haven't played this (And I assume there are some, seeing as how you are reading a review) the game mode works as such. One side starts attacking the other side's trench. Now right now, I know you are reading this like "No♥♥♥♥♥♥Sherlock", but stick with me here. One of two things happen at this point, either the attacker takes the trench, or they are repulsed (Stop looking at me like that). If the attacker is repulsed, then the defender gets to turn the tables and attack the previously known as attacker's trench. Now if the original defender LOSES their trench, the game doesn't continue on in a linear fashion, the attacker has to stop and hold that trench against a counter attack. I know it sounds basic, but it's REALLY nice.Other subtle things, from the way you can only cap trenches by actually being IN the trench, to the way that the timer that says when attack time is over works (Attack Time, Registered Trademark 2014) are so cool but so un-intrusive, that you seem to not notice them, which is a shame because WOO, that's what makes this game worth it.Game-play is sort of, generic? I put a question mark there because I don't want "Generic" to be seen as bad. I mean, Call of Duty is generic in game play terms, but they are still fun games. (Yeah! Call of Duty is fun! I said it! Back off Le' Fedora Army or whatever the hell you snobby people call yourselves, screw it, I'm not a kid, I'm not hip...but I digress)The game-play here does everything it needs to be done to not make the game un-enjoyable, and that's fine. It's a bit hard to review this too in depth, because things are LITERALLY always being tweaked. New Classes, New Features (Just added Gas), adjustments to the little things behind the scenes (And BIG things such as the recent Ballistics tweak which just totally made the game better), all of these things come out pretty frequently, which is great.Downsides? Well, it's in Beta, so you have all of the Beta downside crap, missing sounds, wonky animations sometimes, and a few moments of general clunkiness, but to be honest with you, I have seen finished games with more problems than this game. Finished games, from people with more money, and a bigger studio at that!So! Here we go for you lazy people again, Pros and Cons!Pros:~Innovative "Tug of War" (Officially known as Frontlines) game mode that really makes this feel like a WWI game, not just a WWII FPS with WWI weapons and skins~Honestly, it's all sort of nice to look at~Good support from the developers (You even see them in game from time to time) With frequent updates and fixes.~It's just FUN! Sometimes frustrating, but FUN!Cons~Standard Pre-Release clunkiness shows through from time to time, be it a slow down here, or a glitch there, but these things are usually very quickly addressed in a patch.~Sometimes I feel like the Servers are not big enough, SOMETIMES, but since this isn't a FULL release yet, I won't make too harsh of a judgment on that yet.~NOT ENOUGH MAPS! Holy cow, that's really the only big thing that frustrates me with this game, I love it, I want more of it, I just want more PLACES to make love to the game-play. Summary:A fun take on a rarely touched era for FPS games! AND one of the more amazing efforts from a small studio, period. These guys are working round the clock on this game, and you can certainly see it! If you like FPS games, or Military Shooters, or just like history, YOU NEED THIS, NOW! GET IT! GO!.....SERIOUSLY! You will spend more money on McDonald's and Mountain Dew this week! Get the damned game already!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												Without a doubt the best FPS I have played in a long, long time. Verdun is an extremely addictive, yet insanely hard shooter, which you love and hate at the same time - it is a very abusive relationship. Forcing you to play as a team, Verdun blows other shooters away in the 'teamwork' department, which Battlefield loves to promote in our faces the entire time. If you don't work as a foursome in your individual squads you will die. Again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. This is because you die in a single shot. This is why Verdun is much better than recent shooters: realism. Although no game will ever make you feel like you're truely in a war, Verdun goes for realism and nails it with a nailer. Weapons are fantastic, maps are challenging, and the combat is addictive, as each side attempets to attack and defend their line of trenches.Progression is simple yet awarding, higher rank players aren't ridculously over powered compared to new ones, and that sweet taste of winning a round of an FPS never tasted so good. In short: Verdun shows how triple A games how to do an FPS right: an original idea, dedication, and NO bloody micro-transactions or pay-to-win tactics. I take my hat off to these developers.NB: I'm still afraid to stand up straight in real life.
